p: This study offers new insights into the efficacy of consensus messaging and the role that perceptions of scientific agreement play in informing personal beliefs. The GBM posits that people’s beliefs about scientific issues are influenced by their perceptions of what scientists believe [ 22]. It follows that interventions which change an individual’s perception of a scientific consensus on a given issue would also change their beliefs about the issue. We used an experimental approach to investigate the effect of consensus messages on participants’ perceptions of a scientific consensus on, and beliefs relating to, climate change and the safety of GM food.
